news.title: World forests will collapse if we don’t learn to say ‘no’ – Bill Laurance - The Malaysian Insider
news.summary: An alarming new study has shown that the world’s forests are not only disappearing rapidly, but that areas of “core forest” – remote interior areas critical for disturbance-sensitive wildlife and ecological processes – are vanishing even faster.

blogs.title: How a Dam Building Boom Is Transforming the Brazilian Amazon
blogs.summary: Brazil is in the midst of a hydropower construction boom that is inundating large areas of rainforest and driving indigenous people from their lands — all while failing to fully develop the country’s vast potential for solar and wind energy.

author.name: Yale Environment 360
author.description: Yale Environment 360 is an online magazine offering authoritative opinion, analysis, reporting and debate on global environmental issues. The site (http://e360.yale.edu) features articles by scientists, journalists, and people on the front lines in the environmental field, as well as multimedia content and a daily digest of major environmental news.
